title: cannot setup on win10/MinGW with JAVA_HOME contains space

labels.name: triage/upstream
labels.description: Used for issues which are caused by issues in upstream projects/dependency

labels.name: area/jbang
labels.description: Issues related to when using jbang.dev with Quarkus

body:
### Describe the bug

I tried to follow the "Get Started" https://quarkus.io/get-started/ guide on windows.
Results in Error on the very first step: `.jbang/bin/jbang: line 229: C:\Program: No such file or directory`
my JAVA_HOME is "C:\Program Files\Eclipse Adoptium\jdk-17.0.3.7-hotspot\"  - which contains 2 spaces (pretty normal on windows)

### Expected behavior

no error, proper escape space

### Actual behavior

Error: `.jbang/bin/jbang: line 229: C:\Program: No such file or directory`

### How to Reproduce?

curl -Ls https://sh.jbang.dev | bash -s - trust add https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/quarkus/quarkus-cli/


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

MINGW64_NT-10.0-19044 msno-it11113 3.3.4-341.x86_64 2022-05-09 11:56 UTC x86_64 Msys

### Output of `java -version`

java version "18.0.1.1" 2022-04-22 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 18.0.1.1+2-6) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 18.0.1.1+2-6, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
